text: I thought this would be good for our grandkids but it wasn t good for kids up to 6.disappointed

resp.text: Sorry you feel this way 😢. It is aimed towards smaller children. Most kids 10 and under have a lot fun, especially when they have other kids to play with. I am truly sorry we can’t please everyone

name: Maria Landers
text: This place was so super fun!!! First, the prices are perfect for a few hours to get out the wiggles. They have a separate place for littles 3 and under and a massive crawl thru play place for the older ones. It had a separate snack area with some vending machines and even complimentary coffee! #momwin!

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed yourselves today! Come back and see us again soon :-)

name: Caitlin Moore
text: Great for little ones. My 4 and 1 year old enjoyed it a lot!! We will be back!

name: maryann mccarthy
text: Great place for kids to play safely and indoors esp in inclement weather. Inexpensive way to have a birthday party too. Go check it out.  Small woman owned business.  Support your local businesses esp during these times.

name: Patrina Jones
text: Went with daughter and granddaughter for a birthday day for my boo. The big 2. Had fun. Great place for little ones to play.

name: Jennifer DeForest
text: Brought my Grandson here for the first time today and he had a blast!! Very clean and people are super nice and helpful. Highly recommended!!

name: Taylor Hollis
text: My daughter loves this place. It’s very safe for a small kid and a lot of fun for them. This is our new favorite place in Cullman!

resp.text: Thank you so much!! We love having y’all here 🧡

name: Rachel Bailey
text: This place is super small. My bedroom is bigger than the play area. The prices are crazy for such a small playing space. The infant/toddler play area is a joke. You're WAY better off making the drive to Birmingham or Huntsville to Let's Play.

resp.text: We’re sorry you feel this way! We agree we are no where near as big as Let’s Play but for $5 unlimited play we don’t feel like it’s a bad deal. However if you’re bedroom alone is more than 2,000 sq ft we can see why you would be disappointed.

name: Jacob Hudson
text: Nice, clean and a good time for the kiddos

name: JUDY Stiles
text: Birthday party for our Grandson.We had a great time,kids loved it.

name: Angie Morris
text: Cool for smaller kids

name: Michael Tarvin
text: Friendly atmosphere but not enough variety. Older children will likely become bored quickly.

name: Michael Owens
text: Loved it!

name: Jim Mounier
text: Would  not do business with these people  they expected a offer from marketplace  on a building. Tried calling them  all morning  drove up from  Birmingham  get there  they already sold it  we really was not upset at that   They we’re just rude  when we asked about  it  just short and hateful   We will do business somewhere else

resp.text:
Sir, we are sorry that you feel we run a bad business. The ad said first come, first serve. So yes, we did say that the first one to come in with the deposit, got it. Our business hours are posted on Facebook and Google. The only days we are not in the office is on Saturday afternoon/evening to Sunday. We do try to spend those days with family and "leave work, at work". We are sorry this has upset you enough to leave a bad review, but we are more than happy to keep an eye out for another repo for you in the future.  Please understand that if we held everything for someone that simply asked how to pay a deposit, we wouldn't sell much, because people do not always show up when they say they will. Again, if you would like us to be on the look out for another repo, please let us know.

Have a great day!

name: Sue Doss
text: Haley is awesome

name: RONALD LEVERETT
text: Nice place

name: Stephanie Hodges
text: Such a nice gated subdivision.  BEAUTIFUL homes built on different lakes throughout the neighborhood.  While several homes are not on the water they are still very appealing.  They have two walking parks for everyone including for babies to boot. Sidewalks are not on every street, but walking and enjoying the neighborhood/lakes are the best way to enjoy everyday.

name: Dan Hughes
text:
This is a nice new playground. My youngest (9) loves it. Although I'd say she's on the high side of the ages it's meant for. The equipment is not only new, it's different than what most places have, so it's a good change of options.
Bring a chair with you so you can sit under the shades. Otherwise most of the benches are in the sun.
Overall the place wasn't too messy considering it is hard to get kids to not throw things on the ground. It was mostly just bottle caps, juicebox straw wrappers and napkins. If they added a few more garbage cans it would help. Especially one by the exit.
I thought the restrooms were in decent shape. Again considering they are mostly being used by kids. And every time we've been there, staff members did do a walk-through and spot cleaned them, so that's nice to see. The restrooms are unmarked, so that is a bit confusing but I think they did it to make it more gender neutral. Still some kind of sign would be a good addition because the kids can't easily tell where the restrooms are.
If you go in the morning, there is a bit of a playground subculture where some people congregate together. All of the kids that were there when we have been there were being nice and social, so that was good.

name: Jennifer Nelson
text: This is a very popular new playground for kids of all abilities, right next to the rec center and sports fields. It has shade, water fountains, bathrooms, and tables. While it still needs funding for phase 2 (toddler area, zip line, swings, and rope climber), it has a fantastic central climbing structure with slides, ramps, hidey spaces, plus some other small equipment. This playground sets a new bar for Huntsville. We love it!

name: Eryn Rose
text: Great play area, love that it has shade! The nature theme was a big hit with my kids.

name: NITA SHAH
text: Beautiful playground and excellent for special needs kids

name: Ronald “BIGDADDY” Scott
text: While I sat and talked on the phone, cop pulled up and ask if I was ok. Yes, I replied. He said to call them if I had any trouble. I ask was I to expect any trouble there? He said they had been getting calls about some unwelcomed activity. I said thank you then cop left and I followed.

name: John Anthony
text: It's a single baseball diamond with a woodline as opposed to a fence. There's a little playground next to it. Very nice scenery but there is no shade at all. If you do not bring your own shade like an umbrella it's going to be hot.

name: Chad Stone
text: Low profile park

name: o0LavenderAndSpice0o
text:
Small park with limited play equipment, great for small families, large area for seasonal sports teams for kids. Lots of open space for kids to run, pet station for pet waste bags and disposal bin if you want to bring your dog(s) along.

Prone to "mayhem" after dark when unknown people run "donuts" in the wet grass with their cars, resulting in deep, red clay mud circles all over the open grass area.

For those who play Pokemon Go, it has 2 pokestops (one by the sign near the road,the other back by the play equipment), a small but good cycle of Pokemon in morning and evening, and the international church next-door is a Pokemon gym.

name: Wayne
text: Sleepy playground and walking trail.  Well kept but has almost no visitors due to it's hidden location.

name: tam-me
text: lovely little park!  grounds are well kept.  decent size ball field and little folks adore the playground.  nicely secluded at dead end of shelton rd so no thru traffic.  parking can be limited at times.
